DependsOn: Study Code, Study Name, Program, dbGaP

Description: Unique identifer for the study, assigned by DCC
Valid Values: ABC-DS, ADS, DS-Brain, DS-COG-ALL, DS-COG-AML, DS-Immune, DS-ISP, DS-PALS, DS-PCGC, DS-Sleep, DS360-CHD, DSC, ECODS, ExCEEDS, HTP, TRC-DS, X01-DeSmith, X01-Hakon

Description: Name of the study, chosen by data contributor
Funding source for the study
Valid Values: INCLUDE, KF

Description: dbGaP study accession code

DependsOn: Study Code, Participant ID, External ID, Family ID, Family Type, Father ID, Mother ID, Family Relationship, Sex, Race, Ethnicity, Down Syndrome Status, Outcomes Vital Status, Age at Last Vital Status

Description: Unique identifier for the participant, assigned by DCC
Unique identifier for the participant, assigned by data contributor
Unique identifer for family to which Participant belongs

Structure of family members participating in the study (proband-only = no family members participating; duo = proband + parent; trio = proband + 2 parents; trio+ = proband + 2 parents + other relatives)
Valid Values: Proband-only, Trio, Trio+, Duo, Other

Description: Participant ID for Participant's father
Participant ID for Participant's mother
Relationship of Participant to other family members
Sex of participant
Valid Values: Male, Female, Other, Unknown

Description: Race of participant
Valid Values: White, Black or African American, Asian, More than one race, American Indian or Alaska Native, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, Other, Prefer not to answer, Unknown

Description: Ethnicity of participant
Valid Values: Not Hispanic or Latino, Hispanic or Latino, Prefer not to answer, Unknown

Description: Down Syndrome status of participant (T21 = Trisomy 21; D21 = Disomy 21, euploid)
Whether participant is alive or dead
Age in days when participant's vital status was last recorded

DependsOn: Study Code, Participant ID, Condition Description, Age at Condition Observation, Condition Interpretation, Condition Source, HPO Label, HPO Code, MONDO Label, MONDO Code, MAXO Label, MAXO Code, Other Label, Other Code

Description: Condition as worded by data contributor - this will be displayed in the portal
Age in days at which condition was observed, recorded, or diagnosed

Whether condition was observed or not. "Not Observed" indicates participant was specifically examined for that condition, or health record specifically queried for that condition, and found to be negative. Sept. 2022 release will only include positive assertions.
Valid Values: Observed, Not Observed

Description: Whether condition information was obtained from medical records (Clinical) or patient survey (Self-Reported)
Valid Values: Clinical, Self-Reported

Description: Label for condition in the Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO)
Code for condition in the Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO)
Label for condition in the Mondo Disease Ontology (MONDO)
Code for condition in the Mondo Disease Ontology (MONDO)
Label for condition in the Medical Action Ontology (MAXO)
Code for condition in the Medical Action Ontology (MAXO)
Label for condition in another ontology (if no match in HPO, MONDO, or MAXO)
Code for condition in another ontology (if no match in HPO, MONDO, or MAXO)

DependsOn: Participant ID, Collection ID, Collection Sample Type, Sample ID, Container ID, Sample Type, Parent Sample ID, Parent Sample Type, Age At Biospecimen Collection, Sample Availability, Volume, Volume Unit, Laboratory Procedure, Biospecimen Storage

Description: Identifier for the eldest sample in a lineage of processed, pooled, or aliquoted samples. This may be the same as Parent Sample ID or Sample ID (if no processing was performed).
Type of biological material comprising the collected sample
Valid Values: Whole blood, Not reported, Saliva, Derived cell line

Description: Identifier for sample. A sample is a unique biological material; two samples with two different IDs are biologically distinct.
Identifier for specific container/aliquot of sample, if applicable. For example, distinct aliquots of a sample will have the same Sample ID but different Container IDs.
Type of biological material comprising the sample
Valid Values: Plasma, White blood cells, Red blood cells, DNA, RNA, Peripheral blood mononuclear cells, CD4+ Tconv cells, NK cells, Monocytes, CD8+ T cells, B cells, Granulocytes, Treg cells

Description: Identifier for the direct parent from which Sample was derived, processed, pooled, etc. (if applicable)
Type of biological material comprising the parent sample
Valid Values: Not Reported, Peripheral Whole Blood, Derived Cell Line, Saliva, Whole blood, WBCs

Description: Age in days of participant at time of biospecimen collection
Whether or not the sample is potentially available for sharing through the Virtual Biorepository
Valid Values: Available, Unavailable

Description: Amount of sample in container
Unit of sample volume
Valid Values: ml, ul

Description: Procedure by which Sample was derived from Parent Sample
Valid Values: Centrifugation, RBC lysis, Lyse/fix buffer, FACS, PAXgene DNA, PAXgene RNA, Qiagen Allprep, Ficoll

Description: Method by which Container is stored
Valid Values: Minus 80 degrees Celsius, Liquid nitrogen storage

DependsOn: Participant ID, Sample ID, File ID, Filename, Data Access, Data Category, Data Type, Experimental Strategy, Access URL, Format, Size

Description: File identifier, assigned by DCC
Type of access control on this file, determined by DCC
Valid Values: Controlled, Registered, Open

Description: Name of file, assigned by data contributor
Synapse ID for file
General category of data in file
Valid Values: Clinical, Genomics, Proteomics, Metabolomics, Immune profiling, Transcriptomics

Description: Specific type of data contained in file
Valid Values: Preprocessed metabolite relative abundance, Absolute protein concentration, Aligned reads, Simple nucleotide variations, GVCF, Gene expression quantifications, Gene fusions, Somatic copy number variations, Somatic structural variations

Description: Experimental method used to obtain data in file
Valid Values: Whole genome sequencing, RNAseq, Multiplex immunoassay, Mass spec metabolomics

Description: Storage location for this file
Format of file
Valid Values: tsv, cram, gvcf, vcf, maf, txt, pdf, html, png

Description: Size of file
